subsection_name: viem-dai-trang.json_7_Differentiate between colitis and irritable bowel syndrome
subsection_content:
Colitis: Is an inflammation of the colon lining. This can occur due to bacteria, viruses, parasites, fungi, anemia, or unknown immune damage to the colon.
Irritable bowel syndrome (IBS): Is a functional colon disorder. There was no physical damage to the colon. Patients may have diarrhea, constipation or alternating diarrhea, often occurring after eating. Symptoms of abdominal pain, bloating, and abdominal discomfort often decrease after bowel movements.
